source.8aa8fb50:
itemlist = ""
Q = input("Would you like to make a category? ")
#while loop to keep the program asking
while Q == "yes":
    Category = input("Enter a Category: ")
    number = input("How many would you like on the list? ")
    # Need to change the variable to an int
    number = int(number)
    #need a for loop to enter an item on the list 
    for i in range(number):
        item = input("Enter an item on the list ")
        itemlist = item+","+itemlist
    print(Category, ":" , itemlist)
    itemlist = ""
    Q = input ("Would you like to make another category?")
source.0dfc45fc: The hardest part of this project was the for loops because it was the newest thing. The easiest part of this project was the while loops. I utilized peer feedback by fixing my while loops and for loops. I believe I planned very well and my idea was just the right amount of difficulty. If I had unlimited time I would try to use the python formatting tools and add the function where the program can guess the category.

source.6f3961eb:
Here, write a 1 paragraph reflection answering the following questions:

*   What was the hardest part of this project?
*   What was the easiesy part of this project?
*   How did you utilize your peer feedback?
* What was different between your plan and the final project?
* How well did you plan? Was your idea too easy? Too hard? Just right?
* If you had unlimited time, what would you add to this project?
source.5c688244:
## Project Instructions
Write a program that asks the user for categories. For each category, ask the user for a number of things in that category. You should print something for each category that states the category and the three things in that category.

Here is what running your final program should look like:

```
Would you like to do another category? Yes
Enter a category: animals
How many would you like to list? 3
Enter something in that category: cheetah
Enter something in that category: pelican
Enter something in that category: red panda
animals: cheetah pelican red panda

Would you like to do another category? Yes
How many would you like to list? 3
Enter a category: noises
Enter something in that category: vroom!
Enter something in that category: whirrr!
Enter something in that category: whooosh!
noises: vroom! whirrr! whooosh!

Would you like to do another category? Yes
How many would you like to list? 2
Enter a category: programming languages
Enter something in that category: Python
Enter something in that category: Java
programming languages: Python Java

Would you like to do another category? No
```

Note: You will need to use NESTED control structures

Want to make it better?
* Use Python output formatting tools
* Add functionality that allows users to put in an element, and the program responds with which category it is in.
* Anything else!
source.22553e62:
#### Mastery Possibilities: for loops, while loops, counters/accumulators, printing, user input, and more!
Requirement Description Points Earned
Originality All code is your own. Any code snippets that are not your own are properly cited. No more than 5 lines from any website. 10 points 10
Planning & Reflection The "make a plan" section includes a detailed description of how you plan to complete the project. Reflection is thoughtful and answers all required questions. 10 points 10
Compiles Code Compiles 10 points 10
Comments Code is properly commented 10 points 10
Conventions Naming and style conventions are approriate 10 points 8
Loops Program involves a for loop and a while loop 15 points 15
Variables Program asks whether the user wants to do another, and how many they would like to list. 15 points 15
User Input Program asks for categories and elements in each category 10 points 10
Printing Program prints the category, followed by the elements in the category 10 points 10
--- "Final" Score: 98 / 100 * Awesome! Make sure you start variable names with a lower case letter ---
